channel.title: The Ouija Board
channel.description:
Let's discuss about the Ouija Board. My friend Sam and his mom had a psychic come over his house a few months ago to observe their house because they have been noticing some weird things going on. Stuff would happen like doors would randomly open when they specifically remember shutting them, his mom would always randomly be missing an earring out of a set, their dog acting up at random times like he is scared, etc. You'll also hear random footsteps going on upstairs when me and Sam are chilling in his basement, even when we're the only two home. The psychic was talking to Sam's mom and the psychic randomly asks "Who's Billy?". My name's Bill and that's what Sam's mom always calls me. Now, they have never met this woman in their life and they gave her no facts whatsoever. My friend's mom goes "That's my son's best friend." The psychic replied that that name was being channeled to her through the spirits. They think that I'm a bad influence on Sam and that they should keep an eye on me. The spirits also told the psychic to tell Sam's mom to tell Sam to not stand so close to the road in the morning when he's waiting for the bus. Sam even admitted that he stands right on the edge of the road. It turns out these spirits that are in their house are the original home owners of the house from the 1970's. They're not bad spirits or anything, but that leads me to the topic about the Ouija Board. There are a lot more personal experiences I've had from being over there over night, but I'm getting a little off-topic.
Sam's mom asked the psychic if she should try a Ouija Board and the psychic said absolutely not, those are things you shouldn't mess around with because they open portals for evil spirits to enter your house or body, etc. Anytime I bring up the fact that I wanna bring a Ouija Board to Sam's house, Sam gets all pissy and bitchy with me and get in my face about the shit. I've been watching all these videos on the board and learning more about it, so I decided to make this topic.
What do you guys know about the Ouija Board or have you had any good or bad personal experiences with it? Is it something you should fuck with or not?

item.title: The Ouija Board
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Actually, you idiots, paranormal activity was made by a small film crew for a halloween festival back in 2007. The movie was recently made into a feature film. It wasn’t based off of anything, although im sure they went for the blair witch effect.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ouija Board
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“Mitko, post:54, topic:337471”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=433873.msg3191318#msg3191318 date=1272280474]

[quote author=Mitko link=topic=433873.msg3191317#msg3191317 date=1272280275]

[quote author=Rixxx link=topic=433873.msg3191292#msg3191292 date=1272270210]

no I don’t believe in ghosts.[/quote]
…until you see one for yourself. I used to have a strong disbelief in ghosts until I saw one myself. Ghost stories seem nonsensical because no one can actually describe a ghost or the actual encounter accurately.

I haven’t seen a ghost, but I’ve seen what the brain can do.

That’s a major misconception people ghost-disbelievers have about ghosts.

I could say the same thing about ghost believers. It is a major misconception that you are seeing ghosts when really you’re having temporary sensory hallucinations.

Then you sir must watch Paranormal Activitiesy.
[/quote]That real shit?

FIX’T
[/quote]Just looking at it’s shitty end where she does that crappy thing which you may see in most paranormal movies, shows that it’s all acting and made up.[/quote]Ignore the alternate endings, the rest of the show was based off the recordings.

Read full topic

item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

loved:

Agreed. But to add on onto my post I even asked a question about my baby brother who passed away. None of my mates knew anything about him. I asked the board “What was my brothers name” It replied “Sam” Obviously it was correct.

[quote=“reverce, post:44, topic:337471”]That’s something you say/think , Most of the people do .
But people who have seen such things know better .
Once you have made contact . you will see they exist .
Same about god , god is not a man , its a power . soon mankind will open there eyes and see the ‘real’ world.
Also Don’t use the ouija board , It can get you killed .

google.com

You two obviously don’t get what jme is telling you.
That shit is all in your head and it will make you do things.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ouija Board
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Ideomotor phenomenon

Ideomotor phenomenon is a psychological phenomenon wherein a subject makes motions unconsciously. The ideomotor response (or ideomotor reflex), often abbreviated to IMR, is a concept in hypnosis and psychological research. It is derived from the terms "ideo" (idea, or mental representation) and "motor" (muscular action). The phrase is most commonly used in reference to the process whereby a thought or mental image brings about a seemingly "reflexive" or automatic muscular reaction, often of minu...

Read full topic

item.title: The Ouija Board
item.dc:creator: @loved loved
item.description:
@loved wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:49, topic:337471”][quote author=loved link=topic=433873.msg3191328#msg3191328 date=1272284474]
Did it once, never do it again…I swear nobody was moving the glass. There was 3 of us. I asked will I ever go to USA. It replied “No, Death”. hehe.

Anyway try the board…Once won’t hurt?
[/quote]

Put two slippery circular cards ontop of the planchette. Let physics show you who is moving it. Also use blindfolds and you won’t spell out anything. The movement is unvoluntary and your choices are subconcious.

Perhaps it is a valuble self-learning tool. But I stand by the fact that there are no supernatural powers at work here.[/quote]

Agreed. But to add on onto my post I even asked a question about my baby brother who passed away. None of my mates knew anything about him. I asked the board “What was my brothers name” It replied “Sam” Obviously it was correct.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ouija Board
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:

[quote=“loved, post:48, topic:337471”]Did it once, never do it again…I swear nobody was moving the glass. There was 3 of us. I asked will I ever go to USA. It replied “No, Death”. hehe.

Anyway try the board…Once won’t hurt?[/quote]

Put two slippery circular cards ontop of the planchette. Let physics show you who is moving it. Also use blindfolds and you won’t spell out anything. The movement is unvoluntary and your choices are subconcious.

Perhaps it is a valuble self-learning tool. But I stand by the fact that there are no supernatural powers at work here.

item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Cain_”]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ideomotor_effect[/quote]tl;dr: Subconsciously making motions without realizing it.

That probably explains why my mom got the answer “cancer” when she tried the Ouija board with me. She had a rash that wouldn’t go away for months, and she asked what it was. We found out a month ago that it wasn’t anything serious.

Read full topic
